intro: Hieracium glischrophyes, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, while its leaves are hairy and alternate along the stem. Hieracium glischrophyes is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, sometimes considered invasive in certain regions.
